summary: so since martin freeman wears a wedding ring when he plays everett ross in the mcu i’ve got this headcanon that when he’s not...
body:
so since martin freeman wears a wedding ring when he plays everett ross in the mcu i’ve got this headcanon that when he’s not working for the cia he has this small bookshop that he and his husband own in a really quiet town on the east coast somewhere that sells lgbt+ books as well as like history books and everett’s husband (i’m calling him johnny) orders in loads of spy thrillers like james bond as a joke because he’s so proud of his superspy husband. also they have maybe three cats that just kinda hang around the shop and sleep in the apartment above the shop that everett and johnny live in. every year, no matter where he is in the world, everett always takes a day off and they go to new york pride together. johnny goes all out and buys flags and paints his face and everett just wears a love is love shirt but grins every time he looks and sees how happy johnny is to be around their community. when everett gets shot during black panther, johnny just recieves a patchy voicemail from one of everett’s colleagues telling him vaguely what’s happened, but then he hears nothing else and he goes absolutely out of his mind worrying about everett because what if everett dies alone or what if he’s already dead and no ones thought to tell him because it’s classified or some bs. when everett wakes up in wakanda, one of the first things he asks shuri is can he please call his husband or at least send him a message to let him know he’s safe but nothing goes through and then all the stuff in black panther happens so he can’t call anyway cause he’s a bit preoccupied. when he finally gets to go home johnny literally breaks down crying he’s so relieved, and everett ends up taking a month off work to ‘recover’ and spends a month selling books and just being with his husband for a while.

obvs when the snappening occurs everett just happens to be home that day, mildly oblivious to what’s going on in wakanda and they’re both sat in the shop with cups of tea when johnny just looks up at everett and fades away

All requests are open :)

title: Tony’s Daughter - Part 4
body:
Summary: Tony Stark had a secret daughter, one which he had hidden from the world due to her supernatural abilities. When she turned 20, she begged her father to let her join the Avengers. Little did he know that, in agreeing to this, he was introducing her to the man she would grow to love.

Part 1, Part 2, Part 3, Part 5, Part 6, Part 7 (End)

(Steve Rogers x Reader, Tony Stark (Dad) x Reader)

Warnings: Swearing, mentions of violence

Word Count: 1,149

Requested by: @xxchloegrayxx

“So, you’re sure that’s where he’ll be?” Tony asked. He and the other Avengers were crouched behind a van in the middle of the city. (Y/N) and Steve had gone ahead, to try and get her closer to Bucky so she could read his mind and figure out his plan. Now, she was back with news.

“I’m positive. He plans to take down that building there,” she pointed across the street to a high-rise office block, “in twenty minutes.”

“We best get into position,” Clint said. He motioned for Nat to join him, Bruce following close behind, looking more skittish than usual. Clint was going to wait on the building opposite, in the hope that he could get a clear shot if Bucky went straight for the entrance. Nat and Bruce would hide out in the lobby of the building, for the first round of attack. They just had to hope that the big, green guy was in the mood for fighting.

“We’ll be on the second floor, with Vision and Wanda,” Tony gestured to himself and Thor. “Reindeer Games, you stay here for now. We’ll call you if we need you.” Much to Loki’s disgust, Tony handed him a walky-talky.

“I must admit, I’m not a fan of being treated like a child,” he huffed.

“You try and take over the world and this is what you get. It’s either be back-up or being locked in a padded cell. Your choice,” Tony replied.

“Steve and I will stand by the door. Hopefully we can get Bucky to listen to him,” (Y/N) squeezed Steve’s hand as she spoke.

Tony grimaced at the thought of his daughter being in a battle, but he had been outvoted. The only choice now was to fight. “Let’s move out kids.”

The Avengers took their positions, with Loki lounging on a bench, sulking. He pretended to be completely disinterested in the situation, but secretly he was hurt at being told to sit out.

The supposed battle seemed to happen ridiculously fast. Clint saw Bucky coming a mile off and whistled to alert the others. Cap and (Y/N) braced themselves for an attack, but it never came. Bucky appeared in front of them for a split second, enough to catch Steve’s eye, before vanishing into seemingly thin air. Clint didn’t get a clean enough shot and one of his flaming arrows whooshed past (Y/N)’s ear. She ducked as it exploded into the window of the building. Bucky must have still been close, as she caught a glimpse into his mind.

“Shit,” she muttered. She turned to Steve, her face washed-out, “We need to get everyone out of the building. It was a trap.”

Steve barely had time to comprehend her words before the first explosion went off on the third floor. Glass flew in all directions and littered the street. Steve grabbed (Y/N) and pulled her close to him, protecting her head with his arms. Hulk came charging through the lobby, Nat in hand. Steve released his grip on (Y/N) long enough for her to realise she couldn’t read her dad’s mind. Without thinking, she rushed inside, screaming out to him. “Dad! Dad, where are you?” She made a beeline for the nearest staircase, but just as she reached the foot, the next bomb went off. The stairwell crumbled under the impact of the blast. (Y/N)’s yells became shriller, as desperation set in. her voice was joined by Steve’s, trying to find her amongst the settling dust. Her voice grew hoarse and she could barely manage to call out anymore. That was when a red light illuminated what was left of the room. Vision appeared, with Wanda close behind. In his arms was a lifeless Tony. His face was cut and bleeding. His armour was dented and scraped. Upon seeing this, (Y/N) lost all sense of reality. She broke into uncontrollable sobs, reaching her arms out to her father. Vision shook his head, “We need to get him to a hospital, now.”

Steve took (Y/N)’s arm and pulled her back outside. “We’ll take you home and call Pepper,” he said, as soothingly as he possibly could. (Y/N) had no fight left in her, so let herself be led away. She didn’t even notice when Thor appeared from the wreckage and when Loki immediately joined his brother’s side. The car journey back to the Avengers facility was silent. (Y/N)’s eyes had glazed over. No one dared speak. Vision and Wanda were probably already at the hospital. The only sound was Steve, speaking in hushed tones on the phone to Pepper, “Yes, they’ve taken him to the hospital… I think she’s just in shock… We’ll get her home safe, I promise… Okay… See you soon.”

It wasn’t until (Y/N) was being tucked into her bed, a wet flannel wiping away the dust from her face, that she decided to speak. Her words were croaky, “It’s my fault. It’s all my fault.”

Steve placed the flannel down and pulled his girlfriend to his chest, “It’s not your fault. You weren’t to know. You were just trying to help. I’m proud of you.”

(Y/N) shook her head, clutching at his shirt. “I hurt dad and I proved him right. I’m not ready for battle. I’ve ruined everything. He could have… He could have…” she didn’t finish her sentence, as her voice was taken over by shaky sobs. “Pleas go,” she managed, “I don’t want to hurt you too.”

Steve shook his head, “I’m not going anywhere. I want to take care of you.”

“Please, Steve,” she looked up at him, her eyes watery and bloodshot, “I need to be alone.”

He sighed and stood from the bed. “Fine, but I’ll be back in an hour to check on you.”

(Y/N) didn’t reply. She led down and pulled the covers over her head, hoping they would shield her from the hate she must be getting from the other Avengers and the embarrassment she felt. They had put their trust in her and she had failed. She heard the door click, signalling Steve’s exit. (Y/N) waiting a few moments before moving. She needed to get out and clear her head. She couldn’t be around people who had to be so ashamed of her. So, she took a walk.

There weren’t many places to go around the Avengers facility, as it was in a secluded part of the country. The only place she found solitude was the woods about a mile away. (Y/N) pulled on one of Steve’s hoodies, some jogging bottoms and combat boots and made her way out. It wasn’t as cold as she’d expected, just brisk. She was so wrapped up in her own thoughts, that she didn’t think to read those of anyone who might be following her.

Bucky watched the girl from behind a tree. Now was his perfect moment. His mission: to recruit her to Hydra.

Tag List:  @edwisenpai @chibiyanai @alphaaddict @this-is-happening @alkimara @stupidlysarcastic @mikariell95

Steve grabbed (Y/N) and pulled her close to him, protecting her head with his arms. Hulk came charging through the lobby, Nat in hand. Steve released his grip on (Y/N) long enough for her to realise she couldn’t read her dad’s mind. Without thinking, she rushed inside, screaming out to him. “Dad! Dad, where are you?” She made a beeline for the nearest staircase, but just as she reached the foot, the next bomb went off. The stairwell crumbled under the impact of the blast. (Y/N)’s yells became shriller, as desperation set in. her voice was joined by Steve’s, trying to find her amongst the settling dust. Her voice grew hoarse and she could barely manage to call out anymore. That was when a red light illuminated what was left of the room. Vision appeared, with Wanda close behind. In his arms was a lifeless Tony. His face was cut and bleeding. His armour was dented and scraped. Upon seeing this, (Y/N) lost all sense of reality. She broke into uncontrollable sobs, reaching her arms out to her father. Vision shook his head, “We need to get him to a hospital, now.”

Steve took (Y/N)’s arm and pulled her back outside. “We’ll take you home and call Pepper,” he said, as soothingly as he possibly could. (Y/N) had no fight left in her, so let herself be led away. She didn’t even notice when Thor appeared from the wreckage and when Loki immediately joined his brother’s side. The car journey back to the Avengers facility was silent. (Y/N)’s eyes had glazed over. No one dared speak. Vision and Wanda were probably already at the hospital. The only sound was Steve, speaking in hushed tones on the phone to Pepper, “Yes, they’ve taken him to the hospital… I think she’s just in shock… We’ll get her home safe, I promise… Okay… See you soon.”

It wasn’t until (Y/N) was being tucked into her bed, a wet flannel wiping away the dust from her face, that she decided to speak. Her words were croaky, “It’s my fault. It’s all my fault.”

Steve placed the flannel down and pulled his girlfriend to his chest, “It’s not your fault. You weren’t to know. You were just trying to help. I’m proud of you.”

(Y/N) shook her head, clutching at his shirt. “I hurt dad and I proved him right. I’m not ready for battle. I’ve ruined everything. He could have… He could have…” she didn’t finish her sentence, as her voice was taken over by shaky sobs. “Pleas go,” she managed, “I don’t want to hurt you too.”

Steve shook his head, “I’m not going anywhere. I want to take care of you.”

“Please, Steve,” she looked up at him, her eyes watery and bloodshot, “I need to be alone.”

He sighed and stood from the bed. “Fine, but I’ll be back in an hour to check on you.”

(Y/N) didn’t reply. She led down and pulled the covers over her head, hoping they would shield her from the hate she must be getting from the other Avengers and the embarrassment she felt. They had put their trust in her and she had failed. She heard the door click, signalling Steve’s exit. (Y/N) waiting a few moments before moving. She needed to get out and clear her head. She couldn’t be around people who had to be so ashamed of her. So, she took a walk.

There weren’t many places to go around the Avengers facility, as it was in a secluded part of the country. The only place she found solitude was the woods about a mile away. (Y/N) pulled on one of Steve’s hoodies, some jogging bottoms and combat boots and made her way out. It wasn’t as cold as she’d expected, just brisk. She was so wrapped up in her own thoughts, that she didn’t think to read those of anyone who might be following her.

Bucky watched the girl from behind a tree. Now was his perfect moment. His mission: to recruit her to Hydra.

Tag List:  @edwisenpai @chibiyanai @alphaaddict @this-is-happening @alkimara @stupidlysarcastic @mikariell95
trail.content:
Summary: Tony Stark had a secret daughter, one which he had hidden from the world due to her supernatural abilities. When she turned 20, she begged her father to let her join the Avengers. Little did he know that, in agreeing to this, he was introducing her to the man she would grow to love.

Part 1, Part 2, Part 3, Part 5, Part 6, Part 7 (End)

(Steve Rogers x Reader, Tony Stark (Dad) x Reader)

Warnings: Swearing, mentions of violence

Word Count: 1,149

Requested by: @xxchloegrayxx

“So, you’re sure that’s where he’ll be?” Tony asked. He and the other Avengers were crouched behind a van in the middle of the city. (Y/N) and Steve had gone ahead, to try and get her closer to Bucky so she could read his mind and figure out his plan. Now, she was back with news.

“I’m positive. He plans to take down that building there,” she pointed across the street to a high-rise office block, “in twenty minutes.”

“We best get into position,” Clint said. He motioned for Nat to join him, Bruce following close behind, looking more skittish than usual. Clint was going to wait on the building opposite, in the hope that he could get a clear shot if Bucky went straight for the entrance. Nat and Bruce would hide out in the lobby of the building, for the first round of attack. They just had to hope that the big, green guy was in the mood for fighting.

“We’ll be on the second floor, with Vision and Wanda,” Tony gestured to himself and Thor. “Reindeer Games, you stay here for now. We’ll call you if we need you.” Much to Loki’s disgust, Tony handed him a walky-talky.

“I must admit, I’m not a fan of being treated like a child,” he huffed.

“You try and take over the world and this is what you get. It’s either be back-up or being locked in a padded cell. Your choice,” Tony replied.

“Steve and I will stand by the door. Hopefully we can get Bucky to listen to him,” (Y/N) squeezed Steve’s hand as she spoke.

Tony grimaced at the thought of his daughter being in a battle, but he had been outvoted. The only choice now was to fight. “Let’s move out kids.”

The Avengers took their positions, with Loki lounging on a bench, sulking. He pretended to be completely disinterested in the situation, but secretly he was hurt at being told to sit out.

The supposed battle seemed to happen ridiculously fast. Clint saw Bucky coming a mile off and whistled to alert the others. Cap and (Y/N) braced themselves for an attack, but it never came. Bucky appeared in front of them for a split second, enough to catch Steve’s eye, before vanishing into seemingly thin air. Clint didn’t get a clean enough shot and one of his flaming arrows whooshed past (Y/N)’s ear. She ducked as it exploded into the window of the building. Bucky must have still been close, as she caught a glimpse into his mind.

“Shit,” she muttered. She turned to Steve, her face washed-out, “We need to get everyone out of the building. It was a trap.”

Steve barely had time to comprehend her words before the first explosion went off on the third floor. Glass flew in all directions and littered the street. Steve grabbed (Y/N) and pulled her close to him, protecting her head with his arms. Hulk came charging through the lobby, Nat in hand. Steve released his grip on (Y/N) long enough for her to realise she couldn’t read her dad’s mind. Without thinking, she rushed inside, screaming out to him. “Dad! Dad, where are you?” She made a beeline for the nearest staircase, but just as she reached the foot, the next bomb went off. The stairwell crumbled under the impact of the blast. (Y/N)’s yells became shriller, as desperation set in. her voice was joined by Steve’s, trying to find her amongst the settling dust. Her voice grew hoarse and she could barely manage to call out anymore. That was when a red light illuminated what was left of the room. Vision appeared, with Wanda close behind. In his arms was a lifeless Tony. His face was cut and bleeding. His armour was dented and scraped. Upon seeing this, (Y/N) lost all sense of reality. She broke into uncontrollable sobs, reaching her arms out to her father. Vision shook his head, “We need to get him to a hospital, now.”

Steve took (Y/N)’s arm and pulled her back outside. “We’ll take you home and call Pepper,” he said, as soothingly as he possibly could. (Y/N) had no fight left in her, so let herself be led away. She didn’t even notice when Thor appeared from the wreckage and when Loki immediately joined his brother’s side. The car journey back to the Avengers facility was silent. (Y/N)’s eyes had glazed over. No one dared speak. Vision and Wanda were probably already at the hospital. The only sound was Steve, speaking in hushed tones on the phone to Pepper, “Yes, they’ve taken him to the hospital… I think she’s just in shock… We’ll get her home safe, I promise… Okay… See you soon.”

It wasn’t until (Y/N) was being tucked into her bed, a wet flannel wiping away the dust from her face, that she decided to speak. Her words were croaky, “It’s my fault. It’s all my fault.”

Steve placed the flannel down and pulled his girlfriend to his chest, “It’s not your fault. You weren’t to know. You were just trying to help. I’m proud of you.”

(Y/N) shook her head, clutching at his shirt. “I hurt dad and I proved him right. I’m not ready for battle. I’ve ruined everything. He could have… He could have…” she didn’t finish her sentence, as her voice was taken over by shaky sobs. “Pleas go,” she managed, “I don’t want to hurt you too.”

Steve shook his head, “I’m not going anywhere. I want to take care of you.”

“Please, Steve,” she looked up at him, her eyes watery and bloodshot, “I need to be alone.”

He sighed and stood from the bed. “Fine, but I’ll be back in an hour to check on you.”

(Y/N) didn’t reply. She led down and pulled the covers over her head, hoping they would shield her from the hate she must be getting from the other Avengers and the embarrassment she felt. They had put their trust in her and she had failed. She heard the door click, signalling Steve’s exit. (Y/N) waiting a few moments before moving. She needed to get out and clear her head. She couldn’t be around people who had to be so ashamed of her. So, she took a walk.

There weren’t many places to go around the Avengers facility, as it was in a secluded part of the country. The only place she found solitude was the woods about a mile away. (Y/N) pulled on one of Steve’s hoodies, some jogging bottoms and combat boots and made her way out. It wasn’t as cold as she’d expected, just brisk. She was so wrapped up in her own thoughts, that she didn’t think to read those of anyone who might be following her.

Bucky watched the girl from behind a tree. Now was his perfect moment. His mission: to recruit her to Hydra.

summary: I kind of see Steve Rogers revealing that he's sick or hurt before sacrificing himself in Avengers 4. Like Clint or Rhodey would...
body:
I kind of see Steve Rogers revealing that he’s sick or hurt before sacrificing himself in Avengers 4. Like Clint or Rhodey would tease him about being slower during combat and needing backup and them always saving his ass and they’d jokingly say “so what, you tired, old man?” and towards the end when Steve is about to sacrifice himself and everyone tries to dissuade him saying that there must be another way Steve would say “but it would buy you time. And I’m not sure I have much left anyway.” Tony would ask what he means and Steve would reveal that “the serum’s no longer as effective as it was. I’ve known it for a while. I’m slower. Less alert. I don’t heal like I used to” - and he lifts his shirt up to show a wound he got earlier in the movie that has gotten worse. “I’m just a tired, old man”, he’d say with a soft smile. Tony would suggest making another serum because he can, once they get through this - “Tony, no. It’s time. I know it. When you gotta go, you gotta go”, repeating Rumlow’s words in Civil War.

I’m not sure that would make sense but it sure would make me shed a few tears.

blog.description: This blog is an automated list of all fic posted on the Archive Of Our Own under the Clint Barton/Natasha Romanov pairing tag. The stories are automatically posted here from the AO3 RSS feed using an IFTTT recipe, but this was made easy thanks to astolat (astolat.tumblr.com). If you would like to set up a similar blog, see the instructions tab :) To check announcements regarding these blogs, go to the tumblr tag #ao3feed announcement. (moderated by enjolbutt.tumblr.com) I hope this blog helps when you are in dire need of feels or a laugh, so enjoy! :)

blog.description: pronouns dont bother me, use whatever -  I will fite you - follow me for incorrect quotes, good murder and a lot of eyeliner

summary:
Odin: You have more than one lineage, Loki. You were raised an Asgardian but were birthed by a frost giant
Loki: Why didn't you...
body:
Odin: You have more than one lineage, Loki. You were raised an Asgardian but were birthed by a frost giant
Loki: Why didn't you tell me this before??
Odin: Because understanding the struggle between your two realms, can help you better understand the battle within yourself. Evil and good are always at war inside you, Loki. It is your nature, your legacy. But there is a bright side. What happened years ago can be resolved now... by you. Because of your legacy, you alone can cleanse the sins of your family and the Frost Giants. Born in you, along with all this strife, is the power to restore balance to the world. 
Odin: And also I didn't want anyone to think I'd gotten rid of my first child
Loki: You are a terrible father
Odin, falling asleep: I know

dialogue.label: Odin:
dialogue.phrase: You have more than one lineage, Loki. You were raised an Asgardian but were birthed by a frost giant

It is your nature, your legacy. But there is a bright side. What happened years ago can be resolved now... by you. Because of your legacy, you alone can cleanse the sins of your family and the Frost Giants. Born in you, along with all this strife, is the power to restore balance to the world.
